intro: Allosorus fournieri, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its compact rosette of velvety, fleshy leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. It thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight to flourish. Allosorus fournieri is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
